required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Acute Effect of Vaping on Food Intake
clinical_study.official_title: The Acute Effect of Vaping on Food Intake

brief_summary.textblock: This study assesses the acute effects of a standardized 20-minute vaping episode compared to a non-vaping control condition on ad libitum food intake during a 30-minute buffet meal, occurring approximately 45 minutes after the vaping episode

detailed_description.textblock: Weight control is a common motive for cigarette smoking and nicotine has been shown to suppress appetite and increase resting metabolic rate, and also serves as a behavioral alternative to eating or a distraction from hunger or food craving. Data on the acute effect of e-cigarette use ('vaping') on ad libitum food intake are non-existent. Given that many e-cigarette users report vaping for weight control and that certain e-cigarettes are being actively marketed for weight management and/or suppression of food cravings, addressing this research gap is of the utmost importance.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The study consists of two study visits. During the first visit, participants will undergo a 20-minute vaping condition before consuming an ad libitum buffet meal. During the second visit, participants will undergo a 20-minute control condition (instead of the vaping condition) before consuming an ad libitum buffet meal. The order of the two visits will be counterbalanced among participants.

primary_outcome.description: Energy intake in kilocalories (kcal) during the ad libitum buffet meal will be measured via directly weighed food provision and waste (food/energy intake is calculated by difference).

secondary_outcome.description: Dietary fat intake in kilocalories (kcal) during the ad libitum buffet meal will be measured via directly weighed dietary fat provision and waste (dietary fat intake is calculated by difference).
Carbohydrate intake in kilocalories (kcal) during the ad libitum buffet meal will be measured via directly weighed carbohydrate provision and waste (carbohydrate intake is calculated by difference).
Protein intake in kilocalories (kcal) during the ad libitum buffet meal will be measured via directly weighed protein provision and waste (protein intake is calculated by difference).

Total score in the Food Cravings Questionnaire State after the vaping vs after the non-vaping condition. Fifteen items are rated on a 5-point Likert Scale (Strongly Disagree=1, Disagree=2, Neutral=3, Agree=4, Strongly Agree=5) with higher scores indicating higher food cravings.

arm_group.description: Participants in this arm will undergo the vaping condition during the first visit and the non-vaping condition during the second visit.
Participants in this arm will undergo the non-vaping condition during the first visit and the vaping condition during the second visit.

intervention.description: Participants will be asked to sit in a trailer and use their JUUL device to vape 20 puffs over the next 20 minutes. The trailer has its own ventilation system and will be placed on the top level of the parking deck in front of the clinic building. Participants will use their own JUUL pods with 50% nicotine by weight, which equates to approximately 59 mg/mL. The anticipated amount of nicotine that will be absorbed with 20 puffs is approximately 1.6 mg, which is equal to approximately 1.5 cigarettes. During the vaping period, participants will be monitored via video camera/webcam to verify adherence to the vaping protocol (20 puffs in 20 minutes).
Participants will not vape or have access to their JUUL device but instead will complete a distractor task such as a math worksheet during this period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Regularly vaping e-liquids containing approximately 50% nicotine by weight from a JUUL device several times per day
- A self-reported habitual vaping rate of approximately 20 puffs in 20 minutes
- The participant's JUUL device must be store-bought and unaltered
- The participant's e-liquid must be store-bought and unadulterated (e.g., an original JUUL product and the participant cannot add anything to the liquid)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Exclusion criteria include being unwilling to take 20 puffs from their JUUL device with a pod containing 50% nicotine by weight in 20 minutes
Participants will use their own device and own liquids during this study; they will not be provided with a device or e-liquids. The liquid vaped during the study must be 50% nicotine by volume.

patient_data.ipd_description: Access to individual de-identified data is possible via Pennington Biomedical Research Center's Data Sharing policy.
